content:
This is a behaviour on which I stumble every once in a while: logs in a for loop take a long time to type-check, when in TacticM. Here is a reproducible example:

import Lean.Elab.Tactic.Basic

open Lean Elab Tactic

def Slow : TacticM Unit := do
  for _ in [0:0] do
    (logInfo "Without a type ascription, I am slow")-- : TacticM Unit)

As is, Lean takes some time to check the code above. If you remove )--, so that the type-ascription is present, it takes virtually no time.

A possible answer is that sometimes, type-ascriptions are needed. However, this is almost the only situation where type-checking a meta-definition is slow and is slow consistently, so maybe there is an upstream solution!
